info.title: Alphaus Blue API reference
info.description:
Alphaus provides an API for interacting with its services. Blue API is a RESTful API that can be accessed by an HTTP client such as `curl`, or any HTTP library which is part of most modern programming languages. This API reference is autogenerated from [protocol buffers](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers) defined in this [repository](https://github.com/alphauslabs/blueapi), together with our supported [client libraries](https://alphauslabs.github.io/docs/blueapi/client-sdks/). See the official [documentation](https://alphauslabs.github.io/docs/blueapi/overview/) for more information.

You may encounter the following feature maturity indicators:
- **(WORK-IN-PROGRESS)** - Development is ongoing, don't use yet;
- **(BETA)** - New or experimental features, subject to changes; and
- **(Deprecated)** - Outdated or replaced features.

Some endpoints, especially those that return lists of resources, have streaming responses; newline-separated stream of “chunks”. Each chunk is an envelope that can contain either a response message or an error. Only the last chunk will include an error, if any.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: (BETA) Long operations API. Base URL: https://api.alphaus.cloud/m/blue

get.summary: Lists all account groups.
Gets an account group.

Gets a CloudFormation launch URL for enabling the default cross-account access to your account's cost information based on type.
See comments on the type for more information on what each template does.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Optional. Valid values are `default`, `s3only`, and `apionly`. Defaults to `default` if empty.

`default` - Template for setting up both CUR export and read-only access to cost information. If selected, you need to
deploy this template to `us-east-1` region as CloudFormation only supports the `AWS::CUR::ReportDefinition` in that
region at the moment. The target S3 bucket will also be created in that region. If you prefer your S3 bucket to be located
in a different region, you can use the template from this API by setting the type to `s3only`. After your S3 bucket is
ready, call this API again (type is `default`) and set the `CurS3BucketOption` parameter to `USE_EXISTING`, then set your
bucket name and region accordingly. This is the default for Ripple, unless specified otherwise.

`apionly` - Template for setting up ready-only access to cost information. Handy if you already have exported your CUR to
Alphaus through other means (i.e. manual setup). This template is the same as the `default` type but without the CUR
export definitions. Although not required, we recommend you to deploy this template to allow us to query your cost-related
information such as Reserved Instances, Saving Plans, etc. through the AWS API. At the moment, we only rely on CUR data
which is a best-effort basis and sometimes not accurate. This is the default for Wave(Pro), unless specified otherwise.

`s3only` - A helper template for creating an S3 bucket to be used for CUR export.

All templates are publicly available from the reponse link (`templateUrl`) if you want to audit the included permissions.

post.summary:
Starts validation of a default cross-account access stack deployment. If successful, the
IAM role created from the CloudFormation stack will be registered to the target.
Lists the default cross-account access role(s) attached to accounts under caller.

get.summary: Gets the current default cross-account role attached to the input target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Required. The target AWS account to query.

delete.summary:
Deletes the current default cross-account access role attached to this target account.
This does not delete the CloudFormation deployment in your account.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Required. The target AWS account to delete.

put.summary:
Starts an update to an existing default cross-account access CloudFormation stack for template changes, if any.
Only call this API if the status of your default cross-account access is 'outdated'.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Required. The target AWS account to update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The client id to delete.

get.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS
Retrieves all the existing group root users asscoiated with the organization.

post.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS:
Creates a new root user for a billing group or access group.

get.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS:
Retrieves an group root user.

delete.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS
Deletes an existing group root user.

get.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS:
Retrieves the features available to a user on an Alphaus product. For a list of
valid feature flags, see our documentation at https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/apis/iam.html.

put.summary:
WORK IN PROGRESS:
Updates the features available to a user on an Alphaus product. For a list of
valid feature flags, see our documentation at https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/apis/iam.html.

get.summary: Lists all SSO Identity Providers (IdP).

post.summary: Registers an SSO Identity Provider (IdP).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The IdP id to delete.

get.summary: Lists all IP filters. At the moment, this API is only available to root users.

post.summary:
Creates an IP filter item for IP blacklisting or whitelisting. At the moment,
this API is only available to root users.

delete.summary: Deletes an IP filter item. At the moment, this API is only available to root users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The IP filter id to delete.

get.summary:
Lists all permissions based on the input's scope. For reference, supported
permissions can be found on [https://github.com/mobingi/rbac-permissions].

parameters.name: subUser
parameters.description:
Optional. The subuser to query. If empty (default), query all available permissions.
If set to a valid subuser, query that subuser's permissions, if allowed. You can
also set this field to `me` to query your own permissions.

get.summary: Lists all available roles.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional. If not set, all roles will be returned.

post.summary:
Creates a role. If your `permissions` list contains an `Admin` entry, all other
entries will be discarded except `Admin`. Roles are root user-level. That means
all roles created by the root user, or any subuser that has permissions to
create roles, are available to all subusers.

delete.summary: Deletes a role. Deleting a role will also remove all mappings.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The parent namespace.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The role name to delete.

put.summary: Updates a role. If role name is different, rename mapped role name.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. The new namespace.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. The role name to update.

get.summary: Lists roles attached to the caller or the input.

parameters.name: subUser
parameters.description: Optional. The subuser to query. Defaults to caller if not set.

post.summary:
Maps roles to a subuser. You can only map (or attach) up to 5 roles to a user per namespace.
There is no limit for filtering rules per user.

put.summary:
Updates user-to-role mappings. You can only map (or attach) up to 5 roles to a user per namespace.
There is no limit for filtering rules per user.

get.summary: Lists all subusers.

post.summary: Creates a subuser.

get.summary:
Gets subuser information. This call includes all of the subuser metadata. See
[https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.
If the `{name}` parameter is `me` or `-`, returns the caller information, which
is equivalent to `WhoAmI()` or `GET:/iam/v*/whoami`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The subuser name to delete.

get.summary:
Gets user information about the caller. This call includes all of the user metadata.
See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.
Lists long-running operations.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Optional. The name of the operation's parent resource. Not used at the moment.

parameters.name: asOf
parameters.description:
Optional. List operations on and after this date. Format is yyyymmdd. For example,
if you want to list all operations starting from June 01, 2021, set to `20210601`.
If not set, defaults to the first day of the current UTC month.

parameters.name: includeDone
parameters.description:
Optional. If true, include all operations that are marked as done. Exclude by
default.

get.summary:
Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. You can use this method to
poll the operation result at intervals.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource.

delete.summary:
Deletes a long-running operation. This method indicates that the client is no
longer interested in the operation result. It does not cancel the operation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be deleted.

post.summary:
Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes
a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. On successful
cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with
a value of [google.rpc.Status.code][google.rpc.Status.code] 1, corresponding
to `Code.CANCELLED`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

get.summary: Gets information about the caller's organization.

post.summary: Creates the organization account.

put.summary:
WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Updates organization metadata. See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/]
for the list of supported attributes.

post.summary:
WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Sends (or resends) the verification email. Only valid for unverified
organizations. The verification key will be valid for a day.

WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Verifies an organization using the key received from the verification email.
The verification key is only valid for a day.

get.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Gets current preferences.

post.summary: Writes a new (or update an existing) key:value data in your store.

get.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Gets an access group.

post.summary: Reads the calculation history of all accounts in your billing groups. Only available in Ripple.
Initiates an ondemand import of all registered CUR files. See [https://help.alphaus.cloud/en/articles/3612555-ripple-aws-things-you-need-to-prepare-before-starting] for more information.

get.summary: Lists all billing groups.

post.summary: Registers a billing group.

get.summary: Gets a billing group.
Scans key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: like
parameters.description:
Optional. If non-empty, translates to SQL's `LIKE` operand.
Return all keys by default.

get.summary: Reads a key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Required. The key to read.

delete.summary: Deletes a key:value data from your store.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
Required. The key to delete. To delete all keys, set this to `-` (hyphen).
You can also prefix this with `like:` which translates to SQL's LIKE operator.
For example, `like:%pattern%`.

get.summary: Lists vendor costs calculations history and statuses. Note that status information is sometimes unstable.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: asOf
parameters.description: Optional. List operations on and after this date. Format is yyyymmdd. For example, if you want to list all operations starting from June 01, 2021, set to `20210601`. If not set, defaults to the first day of the current UTC month.

parameters.name: excludeDone
parameters.description: Optional. If true, exclude all operations that are marked as done. Include by default.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Lists the vendor calculator's queued accounts for calculation. If result is non-empty, it means calculation is still in progress for the returned accounts. Only available in Ripple.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Reads the available cost attributes of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave). Similar to the `ReadCosts` API but without the aggregated usages and costs. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Triggers monthly calculations for costs and invoices at either organization or billing group level. For the AWS calculator, aggregation is done at daily and monthly level. Also, all occurrences of the character `|` (pipe) in the CUR descriptions and tag key/values are replaced with the `/` (forward-slash) character. This is due to the `|` character having a special designation in the data processing workflows.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary: Reads the usage-based cost details of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave). At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: orgId

get.summary: Fetches cost forecasts for the specified billing group. Includes historical cost (up to previous month) and forecasted cost (up to three months for now).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: billingInternalId
parameters.description: Optional. Company Id of Billing Group to retrieve. Default value is user's Company Id.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Optional. Forecast frequency. Valid values are `daily` and `monthly`. 
Default value is `daily`.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Optional. Forecast granularity. Valid values are `account`, `category` and `product`. Default value is `account`.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Optional. Start date to get cost forecast. If from_date is less than current date, historical costs are included. If from_date is greater than current date, only forecasted costs are returned. Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Optional. End date to get cost forecast. Currently, we only support 90 days forecasting from the first day of current month. Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

get.summary: Fetches previous month cost vs current month forecast vs current accumulated cost per category for id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Optional. Default is current month. Format: `yyyymm`.

get.summary: Fetches current month daily forecast vs current accumulated daily cost for id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Optional. Default is current month. Format: `yyyymm`.

get.summary: Fetches monthly accumulated costs vs forecasted cost vs budget for the id.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. 'account' or 'acctgroup'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. Account or AccountGroup Id

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Optional. Start month to get cost forecast. Format: `yyyymm`.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Optional. Last month to get cost forecast. Format: `yyyymm`.

post.summary: Reads the usage-based non tag costs of a billing group. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: vendor

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

get.summary: Gets a vendor payer account. This API includes all of the account's metadata. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/ for the list of supported attributes. For AWS, this means a management account (formerly known as master or payer account); for Azure, this means a subscription, for GCP, this means a project.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the account to get.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the account.

get.summary: Gets a payer account's import history, which is a list of timestamps our system tracks when the account's data are imported to our system, which in turn, triggers processing. At the moment, this only supports AWS (CUR files). You can also set {id} to `*` to return all payers' information under the organization.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The account id to query. Could be `*`, which implies all payers.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Optional. The UTC month to query. If empty, defaults to current month. Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

post.summary:
WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Returns a list of accounts that have been updated after invoice along
with the differences in costs, if any. Only available in Ripple.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

get.summary: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Get the utilization details for an organization (or MSP).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Required. Organization Id.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Required. For AWS, "ri" or "sp".

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Optional. The start date of the displayed data. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Optional. The end date of the displayed data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: payerId
parameters.description: Optional. Payer Id.

parameters.name: billingInternalId
parameters.description: Optional. Billing group Id.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Optional. Account group Id.

month.description: The queried month. Format is yyyy-mm.

account.description: The AWS account that is actively processing.

date.description: The target date the account is processing for.

started.description: The timestamp when the calculation has started.

dimensions.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of dimensions to query. Valid values are `productCode`, `serviceCode`, `region`, `zone`, `usageType`, `instanceType`, `operation`, `invoiceId`, `description`, `resourceId`, `tags`, and `costCategories`. Sequence doesn't matter. An empty value implies all attributes will be returned.

ReadCostsRequestAwsOptionsTagFilters.description:
A map of "key:value" tag filters. The key indicates the tag key while the value is the filter tag value which can be prefixed by either "eq:" (equal), "re:" (regular expressions based on https://github.com/google/re2), or "!re:" (reverse "re:"). No prefix is the same as "eq:". Multiple map items will use the logical 'and' operator, e.g. mapfilter1 && mapfilter2 && mapfilter3, etc.

For example, if you want to query lineitems with the tag `project:MY_PROJECT`, set to `{"project":"MY_PROJECT"}`. You can also use regular expressions for tag values, such as `{"name":"re:[A-Za-z0-9]*"}`.

metadata.description: The attributes (key/value pair) of the AccountGroup.

clientSecret.description: API client secret. Only available during creation; otherwise, redacted.

apiFeatureFlags.description: Describes the features and whether or not they are enabled for a particular user.

email.description:
The email address associated with the user. If there is no email
address provided then this field will contain "Not Set".

password.description:
The password associated with the user. This field will only be
populated when the reseller is first created.

groupId.description:
The ID of the group to which the user belongs. This will either
be a billing group ID or an access group ID.

groupName.description:
The name of the group to which the user belongs. This will either
be the name of a billing group or an access group.

groupType.description:
This field describes what type of group to which the user belongs.
This field will contain either a value of "billing_group" or "access_group".

meta.description:
A collection of feature flags and whether or not they should be enabled. 
For a full list of such flags, see https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/apis/groups.html.

passwordUpdateTime.description:
The time when the password was last updated. This value will be null if 
the password has never been updated.

updateTime.description:
The time when the user was last updated. This value will be null if the
user has never been updated.

userAccessId.description:
An ID that uniquely identifies the user in the context of its access group.
If the user does not belong to an access group then this value field will
contain the same value as the user ID.

userId.description: An ID that unqiuely identifies the user.

waveAvailabilityDays.description:
How many days of Wave use remain. This value is only used for trial accounts.
This field cannot be updated.

waveRegistered.description: When the user registered on Wave.

waveStatus.description:
The plan associated with the user. Possible values include "trial",
"limited3" and "limited4".

apiGroupRootUser.description: Describes the fields on an Alphaus root user for a billing group or access group.

parent.description:
The user's parent. If empty or non-existent, it means this user is a root user;
otherwise, it's a subuser.

metadata.description:
The attributes (key/value pair) of the user. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'key/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.

adjustmentsTypeList.description: CUR lineitem types included in Ripple's 'Adjusting Entries'.

excludedServicesFromUsage.description:
List of services that are of type 'Usage' in CUR that are excluded,
optionally converted to Adjustments.

groupId.description: The group id the account is associated with during the query.

date.description: For daily data, format is yyyy-mm-dd; for monthly, yyyy-mm.

resourceId.description: At the moment, this is not yet supported, always empty.

usage.description:
Only set when all columns are specified. Any type of grouping will set
this value to zero.

cost.description: The true cost (calculated) for this lineitem.

unblendedCost.description: The unblended cost as reflected in the CUR for this lineitem.

baseCurrency.description:
The base currency for cost, unblendedCost, effectiveCost, amortizedCost.
Always set to USD, CUR's default currency.

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate used to convert baseCurrency to targetCurrency.

managementAccount.description: The management account (formerly master account) the `productCode` belongs to.

convertedToAdjustments.description: If the product code is converted to Adjustments or not.

metadata.description: The attributes (key/value pair) of the account.

Service-specific metadata associated with the operation. It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata. Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success. If the original method returns
no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is `google.protobuf.Empty`. If the
original method is standard `Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the
resource. For other methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where
`Xxx` is the original method name. For example, if the original method name is
`TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is `TakeSnapshotResponse`.

blueapiapiOperation.description:
This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a
network API call.

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

name.description: The unique name (or id) of the organization.

email.description: The registered email of the organization.

metadata.description:
The metadata (key/value pair) of the organization. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'metakey/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.
The attributes (key/value pair) of the account.

members.description: List of all members under this payer.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

accessGroupId.description: The ID of the access group.

accessGroupName.description: The name of the access group.

accessGroupDescription.description: A description of the access group.

billingGroups.description: A list of billing groups contained in the access group.

v1AccessGroup.description: Defines the fields associated with a Wave access group.

v1AwsCalculationHistory.description: Streaming response message for the Billing.ListAwsCalculationHistory rpc.

invoiceSettings.description: The invoice settings for this billing group.

v1BillingGroupInvoiceSettings.description: Invoice settings for a billing group.

v1BillingGroupVendoredInvoiceSetting.description: Invoice settings that are vendor-specific for each billing group.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. If set to a particular billing group, calculate for that billing group. If empty, calculate for all billing groups.

At the moment, for AWS, this is only valid for account type billing groups, not tag billing groups. If a tag billing group is provided, it is discarded and the calculation is done for the whole organization.

month.description: Optional. The UTC month to calculate. If empty, it defaults to the previous month. Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1CalculateCostsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.CalculateCosts rpc.

force.description: Optional. If set to true, discard existing calculation operation(s), if any, and make this as the active/latest one. By default, if there is an ongoing operation during the call, the request will fail.

accountsOnly.description: Optional. If set to true, only calculate for account-type billing groups. If both `accountsOnly` and `tagsOnly` are set to true, `accountsOnly` will prevail.

tagsOnly.description: Optional. If set to true, only calculate for tags-type billing groups. Discarded when the organization doesn't have any tag-based billing groups configured. If both `accountsOnly` and `tagsOnly` are set to true, `accountsOnly` will prevail.

name.description: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

v1CancelOperationRequest.description: Request message for the Operations.CancelOperation rpc.

v1CostAttributeItem.description: Response message for the Cost.ReadCostAttributes rpc.

v1CostItem.description: Response message wrapper for cloud costs.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.
Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

id.description: Required. The account id to register.

name.description: Optional. If empty, set to the value of `id`.

parent.description: Optional. The parent `billingInternalId` of the billing group to which this account will belong to.

awsOptions.description: Required for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1CreateAccountRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.CreateAccount rpc.

managementAccountId.description: Optional. The management account id (formerly known as master, or payer) to which an account belongs to, initially. If the account is moved to another management account, the system is able to detect it and set this value accordingly.

v1CreateAccountRequestAwsOptions.description: AWS-specific options for registering an account.

name.description: Required. The descriptive name of the API client to create.

v1CreateApiClientRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateApiClient rpc.

billingTitle.title: Optional. The title of the billing

remarks.title: Optional. Any remarks about the billing group

displayCost.title: Optional. Calculation type, true unblended or unblended

exchangeRateType.title: Optional. Exchange rate type, payer or billing group

v1CreateBillingGroupRequest.description: Request message for the Billing.CreateBillingGroup rpc.

target.description: Required. The target AWS account to validate.

v1CreateDefaultCostAccessRequest.description: Request message for the Admin.CreateDefaultCostAccess rpc.

email.description: The email address of the user being created.

password.title:
The password of the user being created. A value will be generated
if not is provided for this field

groupId.description:
The ID of the group to which the user will be added. This must
either be a billing group ID or an access group ID.

groupType.description:
The type of group which is represented by the group ID. Valid values
include "billing_group" or "access_group".

inputType.description:
This value determines whether the password should be auto-generated
or if the plaintext value received with the request should be used. A
value of "Auto" will result in an auto-generated password whereas a
value of "Custom" will result in the password included with the request
being used.

plan.description:
The plan associated with the root-user account. Valid values include
"trial", "limited3" and "limited4".

emailNotification.description:
Whether or not a notification should be sent to the provided email after
the user has been created.

meta.description:
A collection of feature flags and whether or not they should be enabled. For
a full list of such flags, see https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/apis/iam.html.

v1CreateGroupRootUserRequest.title: Request message for the Iam.CreateGroupRootUser rpc

metadata.description: Required. The contents of the metadata file from your IdP.

v1CreateIdentityProviderRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateIdentityProvider rpc.

value.description:
Required. The IP input to filter, either blacklist or whitelist. Should be in
CIDR format (i.e. 1.2.3.4/32).

type.description: Optional. Can be `whitelist` or `blacklist`. Defaults to `blacklist` if empty.

rootUser.description:
Optional. If `rootUser` is valid and `subUser` is empty, filter is for this rootuser.
If both `rootUser` and `subUser` inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

subUser.description:
Optional. If `subuser` is valid, filter is for this subuser; `rootUser` value is discarded.
If both `rootUser` and `subUser` inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

v1CreateIpFilterRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateIpFilter rpc.

description.title: Required. Organization's description or company name

password.description: Optional. User can decide to let the system generates the password.

v1CreateOrgRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

v1CreateOrgResponse.description: Response message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

awsOptions.description: Required for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1CreatePayerAccountRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.CreatePayerAccount rpc.

id.description: Required. The id of the management account.

name.description: Optional. The name, or description of the management account. This is set to `id` when not specified.

roleArn.description: Required. Role ARN for Alphaus to assume for access.

v1CreatePayerAccountRequestAwsOptions.description:
See [https://help.alphaus.cloud/en/articles/3612555-ripple-aws-things-you-need-to-prepare-before-starting] for more information.

See [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/cur-create.html] for more information. Requirements include: Additional report details = 'Include Resource IDS' enabled, Prefix = non-empty (recommendation only), Time granularity = 'Hourly', File format = 'text/csv'.

name.description:
Required. The name of the role to create. Role names should have at least 6
characters in length and 32 characters maximum. It should also be alphanumeric.
Hyphens and underscores are allowed in between. The regular expression used
for validation is `^[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_-]*[A-Za-z0-9]$`.

namespace.description: Required. The namespace where this role will belong.

permissions.description: Required. The list of permissions to attach to this role.

v1CreateRoleRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateRole rpc.

name.description:
Required. Min: 4, max: 18, allowed characters: letters, numbers, `_` (underscore),
`.` (period) and `-` (hyphen) characters.

email.description: Optional. Email address of the subuser.

nickName.description: Optional. Nickname or description. It is set to 'name' if empty.

v1CreateUserRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateUser rpc.

subUser.description: Optional. The subuser to map the roles. Defaults to caller if not set.

roles.description: Required. The roles to map to the user. Limited to 5 items.

v1CreateUserRoleMappingRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1CreateUserRoleMappingResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.CreateUserRoleMapping rpc.

roleArn.description: The role ARN that provides the cross-account access permissions.

externalId.description: The external id for this role.

stackId.description: The id of the CloudFormation stack deployed in the target account.

stackRegion.description: The region where the stack is deployed.

templateUrl.description: The latest template used to deploy the stack.

status.description: This can be `latest`, `outdated`, or some error information.

lastUpdated.description: The last updated timestamp, RFC3339 UTC.

v1DefaultCostAccess.description: Response message for the Admin.GetDefaultCostAccess, Admin.CreateDefaultCostAccess rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

includeDetails.description: Optional. If set to "true", details of the RI or SP list is returned. Default: false.

fromDate.description: Optional. The start date of the displayed data. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

toDate.description: Optional. The end date of the displayed data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

toDate.description: Optional. The end date of the displayed data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

fromDate.description: Optional. The start date of the displayed data. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

toDate.description: Optional. The end date of the displayed data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

launchUrl.description: The CloudFormation launch url. Open it in your browser.

templateUrl.description: The latest CloudFormation template. The version is included in the filename.

stackName.description: The default stack name used. Can be modified.

principal.description: The AWS account that will receive the access. Do not change.

externalId.description: The external id for this role. Do not change.

v1GetDefaultCostAccessTemplateUrlRespons.description: Response message for the Admin.GetDefaultCostAccessTemplateUrl rpc.

v1GetForecastsResponse.description: Response message for GetForecasts per billing group.

timestamps.title: List of timestamps in RFC3339 format with the `T` separator. Example: `2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z`

v1GetPayerAccountImportHistoryResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.GetPayerAccountImportHistory rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

recommendationType.description: Required. Valid values: 'reservation', 'rightsizing', 'scheduling'. Only 'reservation' is supported for now.

type.title:
For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. Valid values: 'combined', 'individual'
Default: 'combined'

riServices.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. List of Services ["AmazonEC2", "AmazonRDS", "AmazonElastiCache", "AmazonES", "AmazonRedshift"]. Default: Empty list.

spServices.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. List of Services ["AmazonECS", "AmazonEKS", "AWSLambda"]. Default: Empty list.

purchaseEC2SavingsPlan.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. If set to "true", recommends EC2 Instance Savings Plan that will cover usage not covered by RI. Default: false.

term.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. Valid values: '1yr', '3yr'. Default: '1yr'.

offeringClass.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. Valid values: 'standard', 'convertible'. Default: 'standard'.

paymentOption.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. Valid values: 'allUpfront', 'partialUpfront', 'noUpfront'. Default: 'allUpfront'.

coveragePercentage.description: For recommendationType = 'reservation'. Optional. Percentage of the usage (in NormalizedUnits) to be covered by Reserved Instance or Savings Plan. Default: 100.

month.description: Optional. The UTC month to import. If empty, it defaults to the current month. Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

filter.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of management accounts to import. If empty, all CURs associated with all your management accounts will be imported.

v1ImportCurFilesRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ImportCurFiles rpc.

id.description:
IP filter item id. Note that this name is transcient and is not fixed. However,
you can use any of its permutations to endpoints that accept it, such as
the `DELETE:/iam/v?/ipfilters/{id}` endpoint, without issues.

target.description:
The target of the filter. If global scope, this is usually empty.
Rootuser name for rootuser scope, and subuser name for subuser scope.
For subuser targets, format is `rootuser/subuser`.

type.description: The type of IP filter. It could be `whitelist` or `blacklist`.

value.description: The IP filter value. Should be in CIDR format.

v1ListAccountGroupsResponse.description: Response message for the Admin.ListAccountGroups rpc.

month.description: Optional. If empty, defaults to current UTC month. Format: yyyymm.

v1ListAwsCalculationHistoryRequest.description: Request message for the Billing.ListAwsCalculationHistory rpc.

v1ListCalculationsHistoryAwsResponse.description: AWS-specific response message for the Cost.ListCalculationsHistory rpc. Should be compatible with the Operations API.

v1ListCalculationsHistoryResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.ListCalculationsHistory rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

month.description: Optional. The UTC month to query. Defaults to current month if empty. Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

v1ListCalculatorRunningAccountsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ListCalculatorRunningAccounts rpc.

v1ListCalculatorRunningAccountsResponse.description: Response message for the Cost.ListCalculatorRunningAccounts rpc.

v1ListIdentityProvidersResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListIdentityProviders rpc.

v1ListPermissionsResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListPermissions rpc.

v1ListRolesResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListRoles rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

billingInternalId.description: Optional. If empty, returns all billing groups.

month.description: Optional. If empty, defaults to current UTC month. Format: yyyymm.

v1ListUsageCostsDriftRequest.description: Request message for the Billing.ListUsageCostsDrift rpc.

v1ListUserRoleMappingsResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.ListUserRoleMappings rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description: Optional. At the moment, only billing internal ids are supported. If set, reads the non-usage-based adjustment details of this group. Valid only if `accountId` is not set. If both `groupId` and `accountId` are not set, reads the adjustment details of the whole organization. Only valid for Ripple users. Implied (or discarded) for Wave(Pro) users.

accountId.description: Optional. If set, reads the non-usaged-based adjustment details of this account. Also invalidates the `billingInternalId` value even if set. If both `billingInternalId` and `accountId` are not set, reads the adjustment details of the whole organization.

startTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1ReadAdjustmentsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadAdjustments rpc.

toCurrency.description: Optional. Set to US dollars (USD) by default (AWS CUR's default currency). You can set it to the desired three-letter currency symbol (i.e. JPY, EUR, GBP), in which case, it will use the latest exchange rates provided by https://fixer.io. If you prefer a custom exchange rate, you can append the rate to the currency's three-letter symbol. For example, `JPY:110.622` for the Japanese Yen. Note that the exchange rate should be against the US dollar (USD).

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the cost attributes of this group. Only valid for Ripple users. Implied as the parent billing group for Wave(Pro) users.

For AWS Ripple, only billing internal ids are supported at the moment. Overriden when `accountId` is set to anything other than `*`. Set this and `accountId` to `*` to read the cost attributes of the whole organization. Optional for AWS Wave(Pro).

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the cost attributes of this account.

For AWS, setting this will override `groupId`. Set this and `groupId` to `*` to read the cost attributes of the whole organization.

startTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`. The oldest supported date is `2020-01-01`.

endTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1ReadCostAttributesRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadCostAttributes rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

groupId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this group. Only valid for Ripple users. Implied as the parent billing group for Wave(Pro) users.

For AWS Ripple, only billing internal ids are supported at the moment. Overriden when `accountId` is set to anything other than `*`. Set this and `accountId` to `*` to read the usage-based cost details of the whole organization. Optional for AWS Wave(Pro).

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this account.

For AWS, setting this will override `groupId`. Set this and `groupId` to `*` to read the usage-based cost details of the whole organization.

startTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: yyyymmdd. The oldest supported date is 2020-01-01.

endTime.description: Optional. The UTC date to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: `yyyymmd`.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1ReadCostsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadCosts rpc.

groupByColumns.description:
Optional. A comma-separated list of columns to aggregate the data into. Valid values are `productCode`, `serviceCode`, `region`, `zone`, `usageType`, `instanceType`, `operation`, `invoiceId`, `description`, and `resourceId`. A special value of `none` is also supported, which means query by date or month per account only.

For example, if you only want the services and region data, you can set this field to `productCode,region`. Your input sequence doesn't matter (although the sequence above is recommended) as the actual sequence is already fixed in the return data (see the definition in https://github.com/alphauslabs/blueapi/blob/main/api/aws/cost.proto), which is generic to specific, top to bottom. Invalid values are discarded. Excluded columns will be empty.

groupByMonth.description:
Optional. If set to true, return data grouped by month within the date range. If you want data that is grouped per account per month, set this to `true`, then set `groupByColumns` to `none`.

You can also use `groupByColumns` while setting this to true. If `groupByColumns` is empty, the default grouping is `productCode`.

groupAccounts.description: Optional. If set to true, group all input accounts into one. Valid only if `groupByMonth` is true.

filters.description: Optional. A list of filtering options. See [ReadCostsRequestAwsOptionsFilters] for more information on each filter item. Multiple filter items will use the logical 'or' operator, e.g. filter1 || filter2 || filter3, etc.

tagFilters.description: WORK-IN-PROGRESS: Optional. A list of filtering options specific for tags. Multiple filter items will use the logical 'or' operator, e.g. filter1 || filter2 || filter3, etc. `includeTags` is implied true if this is non-empty. Discarded when `groupByColumns` field is set or if `groupByMonth` is true.

includeTags.description: Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource tags. Discarded when `groupByColumns` field is set or if `groupByMonth` is true.

includeCostCategories.description: Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource cost category information. Discarded when `groupByColumns` field is set or if `groupByMonth` is true.

toCurrency.description: Optional. Set to US dollars (USD) by default (AWS CUR's default currency). You can set it to the desired three-letter currency symbol (i.e. JPY, EUR, GBP), in which case, it will use the latest exchange rates provided by https://fixer.io. If you prefer a custom exchange rate, you can append the rate to the currency's three-letter symbol. For example, `JPY:110.622` for the Japanese Yen. Note that the exchange rate should be against the US dollar (USD).

forceLatest.description:
Optional. If set to true, always get the up-to-date calculation results. This data isn't necessarily in-sync with your invoice data as AWS could still have updated your CUR files even after you created your invoices. By default, returned data are those that are always in-sync with your invoices.

This field is discarded for Wave(Pro) users. You will always get the latest data that is in-sync with your invoices.

v1ReadCostsRequestAwsOptionsFilters.description:
A map of "key:value" column filters. Dependent on `groupByColumns` and/or `groupByMonth`. The key indicates the column name while the value is the filter value prefixed by either "eq:" (equal), "re:" (regular expressions based on https://github.com/google/re2), or "!re:" (reverse "re:"). No prefix is the same as "eq:". Multiple map items will use the logical 'and' operator, e.g. mapfilter1 && mapfilter2 && mapfilter3, etc.

For example, if you like to filter `productCode` to return only `AmazonEC2`, set to `{"productCode":"eq:AmazonEC2"}` or `{"productCode":"AmazonEC2"}`. You can also use a regular expression like `{"productCode":"re:AmazonEC2|AmazonRDS"}`, which means return all AmazonEC2 or AmazonRDS lineitems. Or reverse regexp, such as `{"productCode":"!re:^AmazonEC2$"}`, which means return all items except `AmazonEC2`.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

billingInternalId.description: Required. The billing internal id to stream.

startTime.description: Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description: Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

groupByMonths.description: Optional. Group services and costs by months in the range of `startTime` and `endTime`. If not set, daily data will be returned.

v1ReadNonTagCostsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadNonTagCosts rpc.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

billingInternalId.description: Required. The billing internal id to stream.

startTime.description: Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description: Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

groupByMonths.description: Optional. Group services and costs by months in the range of `startTime` and `endTime`. If not set, daily data will be returned.

awsOptions.description: Optional. Valid only for the `aws` vendor. AWS-specific options.

v1ReadTagCostsRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadTagCosts rpc.

tagId.description: Optional. If set, only return data for this tagId.

vendor.description: Required. At the moment, only `aws` is supported.

v1UpdateFeatureFlagsRequest.title: Request message for the Iam.UpdateFeatureFlags rpc

v1UpdateMetadataRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdateMetadata rpc.

v1UpdatePasswordRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdatePassword rpc.

name.description: Required. The role name to update.

newName.description: Optional. If set, update the current name to this.

permissions.description: Required. The list of permissions to attach to this role.

v1UpdateRoleRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.UpdateRole rpc.

subUser.description: Optional. The subuser to map the roles. Defaults to caller if not set.

roles.description:
Required. The roles to map to the user. Limited to 5 items. Setting `role` to
empty will remove the mapping.

v1UpdateUserRoleMappingRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.UpdateUserRoleMapping rpc.

v1UpdateUserRoleMappingResponse.description: Response message for the Iam.UpdateUserRoleMapping rpc.

snapshot.description: The total costs saved in your invoice.

v1UsageCostsDrift.description: Streaming response message for the Billing.ListUsageCostsDrift rpc.
